intro: Cucurbitella asperata, commonly known as the rough bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in forested or semi-shaded areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
